explanations.A: Not quite, 6 + 4 = 10, but this answer should be lower as it is 0.6 + 0.4
explanations.B: To add decimal numbers, use column method, making sure the decimal points are in line. This means the tenths column is 6 + 4 = 10, so the 0 is written in the tenths column, then you carry the 1 into the units. (Make sure you put a decimal point in line with the points above). Then in the units column you can see 0 + 0 + 1 = 1. The complete answer is 1.0 or 1.
explanations.C: If we add two positive numbers, our answer can't be less than the numbers we added
explanations.D: Make sure you remember to carry and keep your decimal points inline. The answer can't be less than the two numbers you've added

explanations.A: Not quite. I think you have started the division well, but you can't just put the remainder after the decimal point. Try using the bus stop method and carry the remainder into the next column.
explanations.B: I think you have subtracted rather than dividing. You can use equivalent fractions to make this into a division with just whole numbers.
explanations.C: I think you have done 0.4 divided by 0.6. You need to do it the other way round.
explanations.D: One way of dealing with division involving decimals is to treat the calculation as a fraction in order to then find equivalent fractions that are more manageable. This means that instead of 0.6 ÷ 0.4 we can write 0.6/0.4. Multiplying numerator and denominator by 10 in order to give whole number values gives the fraction 6/4 = 3/2 = 1.5
